titles: Treason arraigned, in answer to Plain English; being a trayterous, and phanatique pamphlet, which was condemned by the Counsel of State, suppressed by authority; and the printer declared against by proclamation. It is directed to the Lord General Monck, and the officers of his army, &c.
author: L'Estrange, Roger, Sir, 1616-1704.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Council of State --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Politics and government --  1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
